snippet.title: Jeremy Clarkson: TV star's X-rated Amber Heard confession before 'boring Johnny Depp case'
snippet.description: Sign up for FREE now and never miss the top Royal stories again.  SUBSCRIBE  Invalid email We will use your email address only for sending you newsletters. Please see our Privacy Notice for details of your data protection rights. Jeremy Clarkson hit the headlines for branding Amber Heard and Johnny Depp’s battle in London High Court “boring” this week. This isn’t the first time the TV star has come under fire for his response to the US actress. When she appeared on ‘Top Gear’, he was deemed to have made a number of X-rated remarks and “ogled” at the star.   Trending    The controversial host, who left the BBC show in 2015 after an altercation with a producer, made inappropriate comments when Amber appeared to promote her film ‘Drive Angry’. She joined a roster of celebrities to try to get the fastest lap time in a “reasonably priced car” back in 2011. During a cringeworthy interview with Jeremy in Series 16 Episode 5, he was reported to have told the actress: “I’m picturing you naked.” She brushed-off the comments but it seemed the star didn’t let go during a number of other remarks, according to the site Stuff.co.nz. Amber explained that her new film was about “loud guns, fast cars and short-shorts – on me, not Nicholas Cage” her co-star.  When the future 'Grand Tour' star asked about her love of “muscle cars”, she recalled that it originated from Texas where “people are obsessed with their cars”.   She revealed that she owned a 1968 Mustang, which she later described as her “baby”, to which the audience replied with impressed sounds.  The future 'Who Wants to be a Millionaire?' host continued: “A ‘68 mustang, that is fantas… No, has there always been big muscle cars or did you go through a period of a [Volkswagen Golf] Rabbit or whatever?” Soon into her answer that she “had everything” it appeared a rude comment came from the audience related to the rabbit comment.  As laughter erupted from the audience, Jeremy yelled: “It’s a [Volkswagen] Golf, you stupid idiot.” Amber explained that her Mustang used to be “cherry red until the last time it got stolen” and confessed: “It gets stolen a lot.”     Jeremy seemed shocked that it couldn’t be tracked down because he thought “it would have been fairly easy to find” due to the rarity and ostentatious nature of the car. Next he moved onto guns, when he seemed to make a reference to the previous “naked” comment.  She explained that she “grew up around guns... gun owners, gun users” and added that her dad “has several on him” at “any given moment”. Amber commented that “it’s just the culture” before she admitted to having a .357 Magnum handgun – famously made by the brand Smith & Wesson. A “phwoar” sound erupted from the audience and Jeremy stared in disbelief at her, before he looked off-camera and said: “I’ve gone again”. Later as she raced around the track, he also said: “Look at those [driving] gloves, Are you actually a murder part-time? They do look like strangler’s gloves to me.” Amber joked along
